task_summary: The robot must perceive and avoid an obstacle, then navigate to and reach the scissors on the table.

task_long_description.overview: This task requires a robotic arm to visually identify both an obstacle (a brown box placed near books) and the scissors positioned further away, plan a safe approach, and reach the scissors without collision. Frames show sequential arm movements, obstacle detection, careful navigation, and approach toward the scissors. The robot uses visual feedback, reacts to detected hazards, and confirms arrival at the goal.
preconditions: Robot power on and arm initialized
Obstacle (box) and scissors placed as shown
stepwise_plan: Check if scissors are visually detectable; scan if needed
Navigate arm to scissors while avoiding obstacle
success_criteria: Robot's end-effector arrives at scissors location
No contact or collision with obstacle during navigation
failure_and_recovery: Failure: scissors not visible; Recovery: scan up to 3 times
Failure: obstacle not visible; Recovery: attempt detection
Failure: navigation blocked; Recovery: replan or retry
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends when robot successfully reaches the scissors or fails after recovery attempts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the scissors

node_specs.description: Checks if scissors are visible to sensors
Scans environment for scissors using a grid pattern search
Checks if obstacle is visible to sensors
Navigates arm to scissors while avoiding obstacle

recovery_strategy: Scan and retry up to three times if scissors not visible
Detect obstacle if not seen in initial check
Abort navigation if path blocked, with possible replan
assumptions: Frame evidence used for object naming ('scissors' and 'obstacle' inferred visually)
Obstacle treated as 'brown_box' via visual grounding; instruction was generic
Scissors visible and targetable; library ports do not specify avoidance path so obstacle check is used
No grasp requiredâ€”only reach per instruction and frames

expected_success_criteria: Arm end effector at scissors after safe, unobstructed approach
